document_data.name: Cyphus Ordinae
document_data.mainbody:
'''Cyphus Ordinae''' was a [[monk]] of the pacifist [[Guarded Mind Order]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''May your journey expand your mind and fill your life with wonders.''|Cyphus Ordinae}}
document_data.Description: Cyphus Ordinae zealously followed the strict laws of his monastic order. He appeared to be fully [[human]] at first glance, but his [[half-elven]] nature became apparent upon close examination. Cyphus had a careworn face of a person who suffered hardships throughout his life. Despite it, he was a friendly man who smiled when meeting strangers and meditated when faced with hardships or danger.
document_data.History:
In [[Kythorn]] of the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, the City of Splendors became once again endangered by the [[drow]] menace from the [[Undermountain]]. The [[Masked Lord]]s determined that the danger was coming from [[Undermountain]], and [[Durnan]], the proprietor of the [[Yawning Portal]], put out a call for adventurers willing to traverse the mega-dungeon and route the evil within.

Cyphus recorded the deaths of several prominent Waterdhavians at the hands of drow assassins and was sent to the Yawning Portal by his order as an observer to witness the descent into the drow den. The Guarded Mind Order was interested in documenting the drow, studying their tactics, and recording information about the dreaded [[Underdark]]. Being a pacifist order of scribes, Cyphus Ordinae refused to participate in the expedition nor participated in the battle that raged when the drow from Undermountain broke into Durnan's establishment and slaughtered some of the adventurers gathered there.
